ðŸŒŸTake one step at a time with these helpful insights to build resilience against anxiety. 

Step 1: Understand your triggers. Before responding to anxiety-prone situations, take time to identify what triggers your anxiety. Is it work, school, or some personal issues? Knowing your triggers can help you manage your reactions better. 

Step 2: Breathwork. Training your body to breathe deeply can help reduce tension and promote relaxation. Practice deep belly breathing a few minutes every day to reduce anxiety levels. 

Step 3: Mindfulness practice. Cultivate the habit of being fully present in the moment. Reject the tendency to overthink about the past or worry about the future. Start by dedicating just 5-10 minutes towards cultivating mindfulness every day. 

Step 4: Adopt a healthy lifestyle. Keep a wholesome diet, exercise regularly, and ensure youâ€™re getting enough sleep. Reducing caffeine and sugar intake also helps to decrease anxiety levels. 

Step 5: Reach out. You are not alone. If your anxiety becomes overwhelming, don't hesitate to seek professional help. There are numerous organizations and individuals ready to provide the assistance you need. 

Remember, it's okay to take baby steps. As long as you're moving, you're growing. Embrace the journey!
